summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to attorney Gloria Allred, notifying her of Jeffrey Epstein's death and providing information about the Victim Notification System for the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, designated to receive notifications on behalf of victims or potential victims in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased defendant in the federal criminal case referenced (Case Number 2018R01618, Docket Number 19-CR-00490).

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter.

connections.description: Allred is designated to receive victim notifications on behalf of victims in the criminal case against Epstein.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority for the federal case against Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Custody Status Update
events.description: As of this date, Jeffrey Epstein was not in the custody of the U.S. Marshal Service and was reported as deceased.

events.title: Victim Notification Letter Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent formal notification to Gloria Allred regarding Epstein's death and victim notification procedures.

locations: One St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
6300 Wilshire Blvd. Suite 1500, Los Angeles, CA 90048
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was deceased as of August 10, 2019, and was no longer in the custody of the U.S. Marshal Service.
The letter confirms the federal criminal case against Epstein: United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, Case Number 2018R01618, Court Docket Number 19-CR-00490.
Attorney Gloria Allred was designated to receive notifications on behalf of victims or potential victims identified in the investigation.
The Victim Notification System (VNS) is the primary method for providing updates and documents related to the case to victims and their representatives.
